intro: Hieracium glaucelloides, commonly known as the glaucous hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant has bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are typically covered in a whitish, powdery coating. Hieracium glaucelloides is a perennial herb that can grow up to 30 centimeters tall, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
